N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 52.18 - Association with inmates and criminals prohibited

State Regulations
(a) An employee shall not knowingly engage in
any conversation, dealing, transaction, association or relationship with any
inmate, former inmate, parolee, former parolee, or visitor, friend, or relative
of same or with any criminal or any other person engaged in unlawful activity
in any manner or form which is not necessary or proper for the discharge of the
employee's duties. (b) An employee
shall immediately report to his supervisor any attempt by a person identified
in subdivision (a) of this section to engage him in a conversation, dealing, transaction, association or relationship in any manner or form which is not
necessary or proper for the discharge of the employee's duties. (c) Exceptions to the above restrictions can
only be authorized by designated officials of the department. Notes
